column4: Help !!   when i try to use ssh to connect my remote server i get this error, Permission denied (publickey,password).
Help !!   when i try to use ssh to connect my remote server i get this error, Permission denied (publickey,password).
are you sure ssh server is running on the remote machine?
of coursed, i can connect from windows xp
what is the command you are using specifically of course omitting ip addresses, etc.  i use ssh all the time, i may be able to help
ssh usernam239@mydomain.com
when you type that and hit enter, you then immediately get the public key/password error without anything else in between?
Permission denied (publickey,password).
??  harisund ??
did you previously exchange keys between the computer you are trying to run the ssh client from and the server?
no, how to do that?
with putty i never exchanged anything
the ssh server, I assume is running linux, correct?
yes linux
i deleted already , doesnt help
is there another user account on the server you can attempt to connect to.  like root maybe?
nope its shared hosting
just to see if it is the computer on your end, could you su to another account on your computer and see if you can log into the server from it?
doesnt work
that's a weird problem.  to make a key on your end type $ ssh-keygen -t rsa
i can't imagine how but possibly that could make a difference
doesnt work
sorry, dude, that's not an error I have ever encountered.  i admit i'm stumped.  i'll give it some more thought though
